Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: WELL LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this well license.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.5: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.6: AUTHORIZED FORMATION: the formation authorized for production. May not be thesame as the projected formation.
Column Comment.7: LICENSE ROUND: Bidding round number for offshore drilling rights.
Column Comment.8: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.9: DIRECTION TO LOCATION: Bearing of the offset distance from the reference pointto the well station, clockwise from the azimuth north.
Column Comment.11: DISTANCE REFERENCE POINT: The location name, or reference point, used inmeasurement of distance to an object (e.g. offshore well) or point. For example:Cape Fear, Port of Aberdeen, Jonesville...
Column Comment.12: DISTANCE TO LOCATION: Distance in miles or kilometers from a reference point tothe location
Column Comment.13: DISTANCE LOCATION OUOM: Distance to location original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: DRILL RIG NUMBER: The proposed number identifying the rig to drill the well.
Column Comment.15: DRILL SLOT: Number for the proposed drill slot on the offshore platform. Platformshave 24 to 32 slots in which to position derricks for drilling.
Column Comment.16: DRILL TOOL TYPE: This reference tables describes the types of drill tools. Forexample cable or rotary.
Column Comment.17: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.18: EXCEPTION GRANTED: Used to indicate the type of exception that has beengranted for the spacing of the well. Exceptions are requested to vary the normal wellspacing for the proposed well.
Column Comment.19: EXCEPTION REQUESTED: indicates that a request to apply non-standard spacingto the proposed well has been made. Such requests are called exception requests.
Column Comment.20: DELETE INDICATOR: Indicator that the license has been deleted/expired.
Column Comment.21: DELETE DATE: Date the license expires based on the date of application.
Column Comment.22: FEES PAID INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the fees reuqired for thislicense or authorization have been paid.
Column Comment.23: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.24: LICENSEE CONTACT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the business associate whois the contact representing the licensee for this license.
Column Comment.25: LICENSE DATE: Date the well license was issued.
Column Comment.26: LICENSE NUMBER: License number for the permit to drill, composed of a prefix,sequence and suffix.
Column Comment.27: NUMBER OF WELLS: Number of wells proposed under a program license.
Column Comment.28: OFFSHORE COMPLETION TYPE: The location of the completion equipment on thedrilling rig. Locations could include Above water, Under water etc.
Column Comment.29: PERMIT REFERENCE NUMBER: A reference number, such as the Rule 37 or 38case number which is given by a regulatory body. Usually pertains to spacing of awell from environmental resources, such as water s upplies, burial sites or otherwells).
Column Comment.30: PERMIT REISSUE DATE: The date the permit was reissued. The state assignednumber expires after a period of time as determined by each state. The operator canrequest an extension of the permit number for an additional six months.
Column Comment.31: WELL PERMIT TYPE: The type of permit (such as Rule 37 or Rule 38 in the State ofTexas) that is given for the well.
Column Comment.32: PLATFORM NAME: Full name of the man-made structure installed to support drillingand production operations.
Column Comment.33: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.34: PROJECTED DEPTH: Projected depth at which the drilling of the wellbore will beterminated.
Column Comment.35: PROJECTED DEPTH OUOM: Projected license depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.36: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit thatis proposed for completion and production (or injection).
Column Comment.37: PROJECTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: Projected true vertical depth of the welldetermined during the permitting of the well.
Column Comment.38: PROJECTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.39: PROPOSED SPUD DATE: The proposed spud date as shown on the licenseapplication.
Column Comment.40: PURPOSE: the purpose for drilling the well, such as to obtain production from theViking, pressure maintenance, bitumen, etc.
Column Comment.41: FEE SCHEDULE IDENTIFIER: unique indentifier for the fee schedule.
Column Comment.42: REGULATION: The regulation under which the application was made.
Column Comment.43: REGULATION SOURCE DOCUMENT: use this FK to reference the location of theregulation text in original literature.
Column Comment.44: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.45: REGULATORY AGENCY CONTACT ID: Unique identifier for the business associatewho is the contact representing the jurisdiction for this license.
Column Comment.46: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.47: RIG CODE: The unique code assigned to each rig or installation. For example, thecode "GA" may be assigned to the drilling rig Glomar Arctic III.
Column Comment.48: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.49: RIG SUBSTRUCTURE: The height of the foundation on which the derrick and enginesits.
Column Comment.50: RIG SUBSTRUCTURE OUOM: Rig sub-structure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.51: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Subtyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.52: RIG TYPE: The type of rig installation. For example land, barge, submersible,platform, jackup, drillship, semisub, artificial island...
Column Comment.53: SECTION OF REGULATIONS: The section of oil and gas regulations under whichthe application was made.
Column Comment.54: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc..
Column Comment.55: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.56: TARGET OBJECTIVE FLUID: A code used to indicate the target objective for thewell; for example, oil, gas, or oil and gas.
Column Comment.57: VIOLATION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this license has been in violationof at least one requirement. Details are captured in the WELL LICENSE FAIL table.
Column Comment.58: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.59: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.60: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.61: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.62: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.63: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.64: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
